title: Lost inbox subfolders on re-install
creator: dlockesf1
content: I had to do a Windows reinstall on my wife's computer. Before that, I backed up the profile file to a backup drive. There were a lot of subfolders on the inbox prior to the transition. Afterwards, I tried both copying and importing the profile folder from the backup drive. In both cases, the subfolders didn't reappear but the messages in the inbox did. Is there any way to recover them? I'm running Thunderbird 137.0.1 on windows 11. The mail is on a POP server. Thanks for any advice.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/135.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: inbox and All Mail
creator: tigerstime
content:
I had to use the gmail recovery tool to restore my messages, 6033 of them. Now all the messages in my All Mail folder are showing up in my inbox folder, all 6033 of them. When I delete a message in my inbox folder it's deleted in my All Mail folder. I've used Tunderbird to organize my mail for many years. This has never happened, so I assume it has something to do with having to use the gmail recovery tool. There should only be 50 or 60 messages in my inbox folder. But if I try to delete the duplicated messages in my inbox, they all disappear in my All Mail folder. I've tried to repair the inbox folder, but it just reconstitutes the 6033 messages. Can this issue be corrected?

Thanks for anyone's help.

Jason

content:
On my Win PC, the version 102.15.1 (32-bit) Thunderbird Inbox Message Preview Pane headers are double spaced and takes up 1/3 of the bottom right pane. title: Since April 11, 2025, I stopped receiving messages from my Google mail account (win10)
creator: Andygj
content:
Dear Team,

Since April 11, 2025, I stopped receiving messages from my Google mail account into Thunderbird. I did a couple of experiments and I can send messages, but I cannot receive them.

I never changed any settings at all and I checked my account settings to see if something had changed randomly, but I could see no abnormalities.

Furthermore, I cannot select an email from the inbox and copy it by dragging and dropping into a folder to backup.

I have been a financially contributing user for many years now.

This could be a killer for my Thunderbird experience.

Any advice would be greatly appreciated.

Andygj

title: Native copy or move message/folder function stops at first error
creator: knanirudh
content:
Hello, I am on Thunderbird 128.9.1 ESR, and I've observed that the native options to copy or move messages or folders from one IMAP account to another IMAP account fails when it encounters the first error such as the one mentioned below, and it never proceeds further. The problem is that it copies in some moves/copies the messages in an order that I am unable to comprehend, hence the folder move keeps getting interrupted with the same error. Is there an option in the settings/configurations that can be used to force TB to continue copying/moving even if it encounters an error? I got around this using the ImportExportNG extension, that did not stop the transfer if it encountered an error, but I had to export the folders through the extension before importing them. I'm now working on a nested directory, and I am hesitant to use the export/import option to avoid confusion.

Errors like this appear often: "The current command did not succeed. The mail server for account ProtonMail responded: unexpected char ':', for header field value: failed to parse header."

Thank you!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:137.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/137.0

title: No messages visible
creator: alan253
content:
I recently imported successfully a large (2GB) folder to Thunderbird on Windows 10.. Soon after I received a message wanting to run compaction. Now I cannot display any messages at all from any folder. There is no message to show that compaction is still running although Task Manager does show show a task with the name of the imported folder using less than 1% CPU.

I am syncing to iCloud which I now gather is not recommended. As far as I can see the Mail is still in the database - the folders are all roughly the expected size. .msf files are all there - small compared to the corresponding mail file but not empty. I tried a repair on the imported folder but it did not make any difference. 

 What can I do please?

title: Email attachments disappearing
creator: pawright
content:
When I select an email which has an attachment (paperclip icon present) then the paperclip disappears and the email is presented without the facility to open the attachment.

This happens only on one folder that I have detected. It doesn't matter whether I select the email from the folder or by using the `search` facility and opening it from there.

If I use Properties>Repair folder, the paperclip re-appears (unless the email is still selected!) but then disappears again when that email is re-selected.

I have tried Properties>Repair and also deleting global-messages-db.sqlite. Also re-installed TB to ver. 137.0.1.

Running WIndows 11 64-bit.

title: After compacting the blue progress line is still visible (bottom right) but no emails are visible. (137.0.1 Win10)
creator: dgoadby
content:
Thunderbird performs a compaction. When it is finished the blue progress line is still showing on the bottom right hand side of the window.

You can select any folder and any view condition (read, all, tags etc) and no emails are shown anywhere.

  • Restarting Thunderbird fixes the problem with no errors.
  • This has happened a lot of times now and is consistent.
  • If you force a compaction the problem does not occur.

Update: Usually, in frustration, I restart Thunderbird to fix the problem. This time, whilst typing this forum question, the problem resolved itself. I guess about ten minutes elapsed before the application righted itself. I will watch for the next incident and see what other information can be observed.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:137.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/137.0;solver_id:181052

title: Email No Longer Arriving
creator: callmoss
content: Please excuse the fact you could fit what I know about email setup on the head of a pin with a lot of room left over. A long time ago I set up Thunderbird to connect to my gmail accounts. I was a broker before I retired recently and wanted a more professional looking email address so I configured something (do NOT remember how I did it) so that when I emailed someone or someone responded to my 'callmoss@gmail.com' address using the pseudonym 'Ben@callmoss.com' it would be recognized by both gmail and by Thunderbird and arrive as if it had been sent to the actual 'callmoss@gmail.com' address. A lot of changes have been being made at Thunderbird but suddenly around 2/26/2025, all my email sent to Ben@callmoss.com stopped arriving and were bounced back. If it's a gmail problem, I'm screwed because I will never be able to contact a Google (Alphabet) human being as that is flat out impossible by phone, mail, email or any other communication known to man or gawd. However, if it's a Thunderbird adjustment that can be made, you guys are always great about helping users out. If you have an idea what I am talking about and can suggest a solution, I would really appreciate it. That email was my main one and a lot of people must be wondering why I suddenly disappeared off the face of the earth. Thanks so much! Ben Alter richlandrealestate@gmail.com beenaltered@gmail.com callmoss@gmail.com

title: Trying to Install Thunderbird , with Hotmail , it says "Too Many Requests" for Login Live
creator: JimDirt
content:
I'm trying to set up Thunderbird since Microstupid decided to stop Windows 10 Mail , I am on Version 21H2 Windows 10 , (its several years old , but the Feature Updates after that one slow my PC's down to about half speed and cause constant blue screens , so I found a program that shuts off Windows Feature Updates but the cost is , I can't download anything that goes through the Microsoft Store because it says I need to Update Windows , not going to happen , so I have to find a email program that lets me install it without needing a Windows Update to continue .. so here I am)

When setting it up it wanted my email , which are Hotmail accounts (I have 2 of them I need to set up) , so when I entered the requested info it wants my Password , so I enter it and it takes me to a Live Login window , where it gives a error saying Too Many Requests , I have no idea what that means and why it gives the error and no explanation how to fix it , I did a search here but it says 0 results for that inquiry , so I can't go any further , I am currently using Outlook(PWA) so I have it on my Taskbar , but it sucks , and for some reason I can only set up 1 email account so I can't get my other emails from my other Hotmail account

Both my accounts go through Microsoft and both use the same Password , so its going to be a issue setting up either of them if I can't get my Password entered without a error because its going to give the same error if I set up the other account , also the "Server" is going through Office 365 and I do not use that , so not sure how to manually configure the incoming and outgoing server for Pop 3 (I think that is what Hotmail uses), its been so many years since I had to do that manually I forgot , but I think that is the problem , is its going through Office 365 and I uninstalled that along with Outlook Classic because it wanted me to pay for it at the last second after installing it , all because some 12 year old at Microstupid wants my PC to act like a Cell Phone while claiming Windows Mail is a Security Risk when I have never been hacked and have used it or some form of it since Windows 95 but they just shut down my email without even telling me they were doing it , its complete BS and Microsoft should be sued and/or FORCED to put it back the way it was , just for the stress they caused

And I have not found a email that is the same as Windows 10 Mail that doesn't require me to Update Windows to install it , even though the programs are not part of Microsoft , so I'm hoping this functions like it , but I can't get it to complete the setup to find out , and I HOPE all my emails and Contacts just transfer over automatically , because I sure don't want to do that manually

Anyway , How do I get past that Error ?? , I am thinking it has to do with it using Office 365 for the Server , which I know was never the old way to do it (back in Windows 95-XP) it used some other Server setup which is what I "think" is the conflict

Also hopefully this works with 21H2 version of Windows because I'm not going to Update it after having to Reformat about 6 times because of the stupid Feature Updates my other PC is a sluggish mess because I updated it and so I just shut it off till I can Reformat it , it takes about a month to get my PC back where it was before , every time I have to do that and I usually end up losing something along the way that won't work anymore , so I won't do it again

Any helpful info/guidance would be appreciated .... Thanks ... Jim

title: copernic with thunderbird
creator: JmarcB
content:
J'utilise un logiciel assez classique, "copernic" pour avoir un index des fichiers dans mon ordinateur. Copernic semble ignorer les courriels, et j'ai demandé pourquoi. On m'a répondu que je dois "avoir le connecteur Thunderbird pour Copernic Desktop Search activé dans Thunderbird" pour que cela fonctionne... Mais comment faire pour "activer Copernic search "dans thunderbird ? J'ai vainement cherché "copernic" dans l'index de Thunderbird ! Merci de m'aider si possible !

To retrieve my files in my computer, I make use of a rather classical software, "Copernic", which scan my files, and produces an easy to use index of my disks. Unfortunately, in setting up its index, Copernic neglects the Thunderbird messages . I asked why. The help service by Copernic told me that I had to activate a connexion called "Copernic desktop search" in Thunderbird ... But how can I do that ? I searched "copernic" in the thunderbird index, without success.. Perhaps, somebody can help me in this trouble... ?

title: Profile Manager / password
creator: chrisnpg
content:
Does anyone know of a plug-in or a way to password protect a profile using the profile manager?

Don't want to create a different windows profile to do this.

title: changing e-mail address from sbcglobal.net to g-mail, continue compatibility with Thunderbird
creator: conniey
content:
14 April 2025 I have used Thunderbird for many years to manage my e-mail. I have an sbcglobal.net e-mail address. This means that my ISP is AT&T. I would like to change my ISP from AT&T to Spectrum. I already have a g-mail e-mail address. My question involves compatibility of g-mail with Thunderbird. How do I find out what version of Thunderbird I have? I see that I must have a Thunderbird version 32 or newer in order for OAuth to function, since Google requires that Thunderbird support OAuth.

I already have numerous Local Files which I have set up when using the sbcglobal.net e-mail address. If I begin to use my g-mail address instead, is there a way that I can transfer all these local folders and their contents into my g-mail account, or will I have to set up each of these local folders in the g-mail account, and then copy their contents from the sbcglobal.net e-mail account into the g-mail account?

What will happen to my e-mail address book, when I switch from sbcglobal.net to g-mail? I do not want to keep the sbcglobal.net e-mail account. I want to eliminate it. Is it possible for me to copy my address book from the sbcglobal.net e-mail account to the g-mail account?

Thank you. Connie Yanicka

title: mail.folderpane.sumSubfolders not working in TB 128?
creator: joeyconnick
content:
Previously, I was able to disable having collapsed folders should message count totals of their subfolders by setting "mail.folderpane.sumSubfolders" to false.

I recently moved to TB 128 and while I still have this set, collapsed folders are still showing message counts that include the message counts of all their subfolders. I want collapsed folders to only show message counts for the messages actually in that particular folder, not the count of all message in all its child folders.

Is there any way to get this back in TB 128?

title: meaning of "Locked=1" in last line of installs.ini and profiles.ini
creator: phil194
content:
I am troubleshooting a problem that arose after I migrated a Thunderbird mail account from an old Win10 64-bit PC to a new Win11 64-bit PC.

I installed TB on the new machine and opened the program without doing anything else, then closed the program. TB created installs.ini and profiles.ini files, both with the following as the last line:

Locked=1

This line had not been in either .ini file on the old installation.

I edited these files to point to the backed-up TB profile from the old machine, but I decided to leave the Locked=1 line in the .ini files.

Was this a mistake? I have a strange problem with the new installation, which I won't report until I understand what the "Locked=1" means, and whether I was ill-advised to leave it/them in. Fortunately there has been no evident loss of mail data.

Thanks in advance, Phil
